messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] RE:Shackleton
messages.msgSnippet: We saw the Shackleton show on PBS and have glanced at a book about him (I think it has Endurance in the title).  I read a book last year that was similar to
messages.messageBody:
We saw the Shackleton show on PBS and have glanced at a book about him (I
think it has Endurance in the title). I read a book last year that was
similar to the Shackleton story except it took place in the Arctic and the
captain abandoned the crew. It was a true story. I can't think of the name
of it right now.
Mary-NY

messages.subject: RE:Shackleton
messages.msgSnippet: ... We did, and I was particularly proud of tuning in the second night since Part I, IMHO, was dreadfully dull. (See how listening to proper English makes you
messages.messageBody:
>>Did anyone watch "Shackleton" on A&E?<<

We did, and I was particularly proud of tuning in the second night since
Part I, IMHO, was dreadfully dull. (See how listening to proper English
makes you sound? :))

If you have an IMAX theater near you, there's an IMAX movie out now called
Shackleton's Antarctic Adventure: http://main.wgbh.org/imax/shackleton/ I
think I'll try to see it in Ft. Worth.

Karen

Helen

messages.subject: Shackleton
messages.msgSnippet: Did anyone watch Shackleton on A&E? I had read his book South so I was pumped.  My older kids (11 and 8) got into it as well.  We ended up staying up late,
messages.messageBody:
Did anyone watch "Shackleton" on A&E?

I had read his book "South" so I was pumped. My older kids (11 and 8) got
into it as well. We ended up staying up late, eating popcorn, having out
the globe to follow the exploits. (Our globe even has Shackleton's base
camp denoted which was cool). I showed the kids some of the pictures in
"South" and we saw the scenes that matched the pictures exactly (like the
officers washing the galley floor). It made it all seem very real.

Dh taped the second night for us because we had karate and so now even the
little guys are watching the daring do over and over. Everyone is running
around saying "Bloody hell" in our best English accents which sent us off
laughing over other English sayings we have heard friends from the UK use.
It has been fun.

Julie
